byline.contributor: Melissa Eddy contributed reporting from Le Bourget, France, and Caroline Chauvet from Paris.

abstract: French government takes special pride in successful outcome of United Nations climate change talks, feeling their efforts to be perfect conference hosts smoothed negotiations; officials decide to accommodate historic meeting despite reeling from deadly terrorist attacks, migrant crisis, failing economy and challenges to its leadership by far-right politicians.
lead_paragraph: Whether France’s success in holding the climate talks will translate into any more lasting gains on other fronts in a country that has struggled this year with terror attacks remains to be seen.

headline.main: Despite Internal Struggles, France Sees Bright Spot as a Successful Host
headline.print_headline: Despite Internal Struggles, France Sees Bright Spot as a Successful Host

snippet: Whether France’s success in holding the climate talks will translate into any more lasting gains on other fronts in a country that has struggled this year with terror attacks remains to be seen.

keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
